question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Take care to ensure that the code you generate is executable. I want to create a website for managing post-accident summary materials, with file upload and management functionality, similar to China Judgments Online. Thank you.

checklist.title: Is the file upload and management system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements multi-format file upload (PDF, DOC, DOCX, images) with proper file validation, size limits, and storage mechanisms. Check if file management includes operations like view, download, delete, and categorization. Score 0 if core upload functionality is missing, 5 if only basic upload is implemented, and 10 if comprehensive file management with metadata handling is fully included.

checklist.title: Is the document search and filtering functionality implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the system includes advanced search capabilities with filters for case type, date range, keywords, and document categories. Evaluate if search results are properly paginated and sorted. Two-way verification between front-end filtering and back-end queries is required. Deduct 5 points if full-text search is missing, and 3 points if search performance is not optimized. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the user authentication and authorization system properly designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the system implements role-based access control (RBAC) with proper user authentication, session management, and permission levels for different user types (admin, reviewer, public). Check if secure login/logout mechanisms are implemented with proper password encryption. Deduct 5 points if JWT token management is missing. Check whether user session timeout and security measures are implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the complete document lifecycle and audit trail constructed?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes complete document management lifecycle, including document status tracking (draft, under review, approved, published), version control, and audit logging. Deduct 5 points if document versioning is not implemented, and 3 points if audit trail logging is missing. Give 10 points if comprehensive workflow management with approval processes is fully implemented.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as file upload failures, database connection errors, invalid user inputs, large file handling, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. OCR text extraction from uploaded documents 2. AI-powered document categorization 3. Advanced analytics dashboard 4. Document preview with annotation capabilities). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple file upload handlers coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to document management (e.g., a built-in social media feed) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations during file processing). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating API layer/business logic/data access layers), error handling patterns, and security best practices implementation. Deduct 5 points if SQL injection vulnerabilities are found or input validation is missing; deduct 5 points if the code structure is not properly organized with MVC pattern; deduct 5 points if no logging mechanism is implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern web design principles: 1) Professional color scheme suitable for legal/official documents (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing with consistent grid system (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional typography system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times) 4) Clear navigation and breadcrumb structure. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for unprofessional color combinations, and 5 points for chaotic information hierarchy. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to professional web application standards: 1) File upload progress indication with real-time feedback 2) Loading states for search and filtering operations ≤ 200ms response 3) Smooth transitions between different views (300-500ms duration) 4) Clear visual feedback for all user actions 5) Accessible keyboard navigation. Deduct 5 points for each operation without proper feedback, 3 points for slow file processing without progress indication, and 5 points for hard-to-find critical functions. The full score is 10 points.
